artifactDefinition.businessDescription: A token class that implements this behavior will have restrictions preventing certain behaviors like transferable, burnable, etc. from working while it is encumbered. The encumbering party should make a request to encumber, the owner should be notified about the request, and accept the request, which will finalize the encumbrance and send the EncumberResponse message to the requestor.
artifactDefinition.businessExample: For example, a property title's owner may have obtained a loan from a bank to purchase the property. The loan represents a contract between the owner of the property and the bank, this loan encumbers the property title preventing the owner from being able to sell the property, transferable, to another party until the loan is paid off. Paying off the loan will remove the encumber, which will allow transferable to be invoked.
artifactDefinition.comments: The token definition should have a Encumbered property or structure that may allow only one encumber or allow multiple.

behaviorInvocations.name: EncumberRequest
behaviorInvocations.description: A Request by a party or account, perhaps a contract or another token, to encumber the token.

inputParameters.name: Name of Encumber
inputParameters.valueDescription: Name of the institution requesting the encumber.

inputParameters.name: Identifier
inputParameters.valueDescription: A public key or address for the requestor.

inputParameters.name: Signature
inputParameters.valueDescription: A digital signature or attestation, optional.

outputParameters.name: Confirmation
outputParameters.valueDescription: A confirmation response from the token for the encumber request.

behaviorInvocations.name: AcceptEncumberRequest
behaviorInvocations.description: A Request by a party or account, perhaps a contract or another token, to encumber the token.  Once accepted, the token should add a new entry into the Encumbrances property.

outputParameters.name: Confirmation
outputParameters.valueDescription: A confirmation response returned to the owner of their acceptance.

behaviorInvocations.name: RemoveEncumberRequest
behaviorInvocations.description: A Request by encumbrancer, perhaps a contract or another token, to remove their encumber or lien from the token.  Which should remove any restrictions from behaviors if there are no more encumbers.  Only the owner of the encumber can remove their encumber.

outputParameters.name: Confirmation
outputParameters.valueDescription: A confirmation receipt or denial be returned to the RemoveEncumber requestor.
